comment: Madame Bonn is the best! A lot like a high school teacher, but cares about her students. Gives power points and notes. Uses the book a lot! Great professor, I would highly suggest her!

Madame Bonn was a good teacher. She did her best to teach the material thoroughly and efficiently. Shes really sweet and understanding. Attendance is required. I did learn alot in the class, my only complaint was that we really didn't learn to speak or understand spoken French, we more learned to read and write it.

Definitely do not take this class if your overall goal is to advance in comprehension of the french language. Goes extremely fast, like continuing on with lecture when 1/2 of the class is working activity assigned 5 minutes prior. Does not "pound in term" learned. More about finishing her pre-assigned goal for the day, than student comprehending.

She is a very nice lady! However, I didn't think she spoke enough French in the classroom. She left too much opportunity for the students to speak English with each other during group work. She grades her tests tough but there are plenty of other easy grades to make up for it. She's very understanding.

She was extremely helpful. Very clear with lecture. Made learning French fun. Almost impossible to fail . Very down to Earth. Caring and understanding...always available to help and gets you involved in the language and learning. Take her!

I love her personality. She is so easy to talk to about random stuff and she is very down to earth. If you suck at French, she can prob make you like it and you can def pass her class. However, if you want to learn the language she rushes over everything assuming we know it so if you are not naturally good, you may need someone who will 'go slow'.

A lot like a high school class. Colorful powerpoints, worksheets, bingo, group activities. But it was all pretty easy. A few out of class things to go to, few writing assignments, and some online assignments that count for a huge chunk. Offers extra credit. Definitely get the textbook too, it helps a lot!

Nice as a prsn, not a good teacher. Rushes over material, limited time given 2 practice speaking. Focus:2 b liked & play games. B prepared 2 jot down limited notes & b frustrated when u have 2 go back&teach yourself. Homework is online & mostly culture stuff. If u want 2 learn properly take a different prof. if u want to waste class time take bonn.

Prof. Bonn is a great person, but I felt that she didn't do a great job of teaching. Some days I would leave class feeling like it was a waste of time. However, if you have a pretty good grasp  on French, then you will love this class. I wasn't as prepared as I thought I was so I got a B, only after much extra credit.

Mrs. Bonn is a great professor! Attendance is not required and there is NOOO homework ever! Only a few assignments to do online and you have unlimited attempts to do them. Her lectures are kind of pointless but she is a VERY easy grader and won't sleep at night unless your passing! Only worthless low-lifes fail her classes!!!!
As a student who never took French in high school, I found this class somewhat difficult. Nevertheless, I walked away with a B. Watch out for her exams! Tricky.
WOW I LEARNED SO MUCH YOU CAN NEVER FIRE HER!! TAKE HER ON FULL TIME!!!!
MRS BONN IS THE BOMB!!!! I LOVE FRENCH
She's a great teacher and she goes above and beyond to help you. I enjoyed going to her class...I just wish I could have had her for the next level of French. I recommend her.
Madame Bonn is awesome. I did feel pressure that she expected me to know french previous to the class. I knew nothing and tried really hard. But she is overall pretty fair and her class is enjoyable!

Mme. Bonn is a humorous and friendly teacher/person. While I enjoyed her class, I felt like she expected us to already have some previous knowledge of the language even though it was a 1001 course. She gives lots of Extra credit opps, but she says her test are easy, when they really aren't. Good news is, the tests aren't the majority of your grade!

Okay she was a great teacher...easy or whatever, but her class is taught like a high school class.  Come prepared to eat, color, play games and watch movies.  I just wish she prepared us for the next level of french.
